qas.question: The chirigotas, choirs and comparsas are the most famous of what?
What do the chirigotas sing about?

answers.text: politics, new times and household topics

qas.question: How long does it take for a chirigota to prepare their costume?
Which group rides around in open carts through the streets?
Who has the most elaborated polyphony?

context: The most famous <a0_0>groups<a0_0/> are the chirigotas, choirs and comparsas. The chirigotas are well known witty, satiric popular groups who sing about <a1_0>politics, new times and household topics<a1_0/>, wearing the same costume, which they prepare for <a2_0>the whole year<a2_0/>. <a3_0>The Choirs<a3_0/> (coros) are wider groups that go on open carts through the streets singing with an orchestra of guitars and lutes. Their signature piece is the "Carnival Tango", alternating comical and serious repertory. <a4_0>The comparsas<a4_0/> are the serious counterpart of the chirigota in Cádiz, and the poetic lyrics and the criticism are their main ingredients. They have a more elaborated polyphony that is easily recognizable by the typical countertenor voice.
